author: Paul
content: Tariff concerns. They are way overblown. It's really a great way to get what you want,provided you have the muscle and will to prevail. The USA will cease to be the world cash register and product dumping ground.

author: Robert
content: Coming back.  Is it possible get a gain in AMZN today?

author: DStateGovernor
content: Bullish: We need you AMZN.  Cruise on.

author: Gold is the new TINA
content: 90% of items sold by Amazon are from China. Amazon  stock must get a big haircut as revenues and earnings will drop big. Ikea says the same this this morning. Walmart CFO Says They Don't Want To Raise Prices, But 'Prices Will Go Up For Consumers' Due To Upcoming Tariffs

author: Ray
content: The tariffs on China and other countries seems bad for Amazon yet stock keeps going up.

author: Kaiden
content: I’ve held AMZN through dips for years, and every time it’s paid off. $300+ isn’t a question of if, but when.

author: Harold
content: Long-term, AMZN is a bet on global e-commerce and logistics. Every dip in the stock has been a buying opportunity for me since 2018. Not selling until I see $300+.

author: Oscar
content: Added more AMZN today after seeing Anthropic’s latest AI demo. This partnership isn’t just about catching up to Microsoft or Google—it’s about setting a new standard in cloud AI integration.

author: Randall
content: Can we talk about AMZN’s advertising segment? $14.3 billion in revenue last quarter and growing faster than expected. It’s becoming the hidden gem of their business model.

author: Willie
content: Bearish: Macro risks are real. Recession fears might hit AMZN hard next year.
